conbody.p: To reduce record sizes in Redis database, field name mapping is enabled by default in NCC CDR streams. It maps field names (such as Result-Code) to a shorter number representation (for example, 23). These mappings are defined in a field name mapping file, which can be read by each node that requires to use field name mapping. The field name mapping file is bundled in the CFG package of CG Configuration Node.
When field name mapping is enabled, all the field names in the database are stored as numbers (both input and output fields).

For debugging purposes, it is sometimes useful to see the full records stored into the database in readable format. To disable field mapping, set environment variable CG_DisableFieldMapping to value true as follows:

ol.li:
Modify Data Refinery node manager configuration files on the processing host where you want to debug.
In the following files, add the CG_DisableFieldMapping variable and set it to true:
/etc/profile.d/el-node-manager.sh
/etc/sysconfig/el-node-manager
In the following file, add the variable name CG_DisableFieldMapping into the defaultEnvironment list property:
/opt/comptel/eventlink/etc/node-manager/eventlink-config.xml

Restart node manager:
sudo systemctl restart el-node-manager
